meanings.definition: A person who advocates for the freeing of slaves.
meanings.sent1: The brave emancipationists fought for the freedom of enslaved people.
meanings.sent2: Many emancipationists in history worked tirelessly to end slavery.
meanings.sent3: The group of emancipationists organized a peaceful protest to demand the release of slaves.
meanings.sent4: The spirit of the emancipationists soared as they saw the chains of slavery breaking.
meanings.sent5: The image of the emancipationists standing up for justice remains etched in our minds.

meanings.definition: Those who support the liberation of oppressed individuals.
meanings.sent1: Emancipationists believe in fighting for the rights of those who are unfairly treated.
meanings.sent2: Support from emancipationists can make a significant difference in the lives of the oppressed.
meanings.sent3: The gathering of emancipationists brought a sense of hope to the marginalized communities.
meanings.sent4: The words of the emancipationists echoed through the streets, inspiring others to join the cause.
meanings.sent5: The dedication of the emancipationists shines brightly in the fight against injustice.
